children.name: Sayedna Imam Hasan al-Musanna R.A
children.about: One of the noble sons of Hazrat Hasan ibn Ali R.A. An important figure of the lineage of Imam Hasan continued after Karbala. He's one of the few male descendants of Imam Hasand who survived karbala due to the intervention of his maternal relatives from Banu Fazara

burial.place: Jannat al Baqi, Madina, Saudi Arabia

spouse.name: Syeda Hazrat Fatima bint Hussain R.A
spouse.fname: Syedna Hazrat Hussain ibn Ali R.A
spouse.about: She was one of the prominent figure present at the tragedy of Karbala and taken as part of the captives to Kufa and Damascus, and later returned to Madina.

children.name: Syedna Abdullah Al-Mahz R.H
children.about: Otherwise known as Abdullah al-Kamil and Abdullah al-Akbar. He's known for his piety, leadership and being father of Muhammad al-Nafz al-Zakiyya and Idris (Founder of the Idrisi dynasty in Morocco). He died in 762 CE in improsonment under the Abbasid caliph al-Mansur.

spouse.name: Hazrat Hind bint Abi Ubayda
spouse.about: Most commonly mentioned wife of Abdullah al-Mahz in Syed lineage.

children.name: Syedna Moosa al-jawn R.H
children.about: Al-Jawn means dark/olive complexion. Given as laqab probably.

children.about: He or his father came to India and settled in Manikpur. He was very renowned for his sprituality and was given the title by the king of that period. His shrine is located in Manikpur, Uttar Pradesh, India.(Bar Kawah koh). Reasearch on his life is still going on and more details are expected to be revealed in the future.

children.about: He came to Bihar and settled in Gaya District. Details about his life are under research. He got burried in Gaya district at a place called Mira Peth. Multiple graves are present at the site and research is going on.

children.about: He got settled in near by village named Miran Bigha, Tekari its old name was saidpura. His shrine is located in Miran Bigha, Tekari. Urs is celebrated every year on 12th of Zul Hijja.

children.name: Sayedna Hazrat Mohsin ibn Ali R.A
children.about: Muhsin ibn Ali, also spelled Mohsin, was the youngest son of Fatima bint Muhammad and Ali ibn Abi Talib, and thus a maternal grandson of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. He was a brother of Husayn and Hasan. Controversy surrounds the fate of Muhsin as some canonical Shia sources report that Muhsin died in miscarriage, following a raid on Fatima's house led by Umar, a companion of Muhammad (PBUH). Alternatively, Sunnis hold that Muhsin died in infancy of natural causes.
